channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: A NASA Space Telescope Is Falling Out of the Sky. Can This Startup Save it?
item.description: In 2026, a first-of-its-kind spacecraft—launched on a rocket dropped out of a plane—will attempt to save NASA’s Swift observatory from a fiery demise. Yes, really.

item.title: Wicked: For Good is a soaring second act that brings it all full circle
item.description: When Jon M. Chu first announced that his big-screen Wicked adaptation would be split into two parts, there was concern about whether the original musical's second act could be fashioned into a fully fleshed-out movie. Compared to the stage show's lengthy first act, where all the musical's most recognizable songs are front-loaded, the second act […]

item.title: WhatsApp gets its own Instagram Notes-like feature
item.description: WhatsApp users can now share their status with others through a new "About" feature.

item.title: 25 incredible floorcare deals in the early Black Friday sales – up to 55% off vacuums, steam cleaners and more
item.description: The early Black Friday sales have started with a bang, and the floorcare deals are especially strong.

item.title: I Can’t Believe How in Love I Am With ‘Hades 2’
item.description: The sequel to the 2020 hit from Supergiant Games is now available on Switch 2, and has me falling in love with the godlike roguelike all over again.

item.title: Creating images with ChatGPT is fun, but these simple tips will make them look way better
item.description: ChatGPT image creation is easier than you think – once you know where to look and what to ask

item.title: Bethesda’s $300 Pip-Boy 3000 replica can measure (harmless) radiation
item.description: Bethesda is now selling a highly-detailed wearable replica of the Pip-Boy 3000 from Fallout 3 and Fallout: New Vegas. It was designed using the 3D models of the accessory in the games to make it as accurate as possible, and is available for preorder now for $299.99, with shipping expected to start as early as […]

item.title: The Verge’s favorite holiday gifts under $100
item.description: Between all the new phones, smartwatches, and laptops we see throughout the year, it often feels like we're constantly being nudged toward shinier, more expensive gadgets. And I get it. As a self-professed gadget nerd, few things are more exciting than unboxing and setting up a new device. But the truth is, you can still […]

item.title: Pornhub Begs Tech Giants to Verify User Ages on Their Device: Report
item.description: We're moving closer to digital IDs.

item.title: Goodbye pesky cables - Kingston reveals new wire-free portable SSD offering up to 2TB storage and up to 1,050 MB/s data transfers, and it'll fit into even your smallest pocket
item.description: Kingston releases its first cable-free portable SSD offering dual USB connectors, 2TB storage, and high-speed USB 3.2 Gen 2 transfer.

item.title: This laptop is powered by a processor that was discontinued when Obama was president, but for $49, you can use it as a doorstop in a pinch
item.description: The Dell Chromebook 3120 is barely recommendable, but for just $49, I'm sure you can find something useful for it to do.

item.title: Windows 1.0 released 40 years ago today - and started Microsoft's road to success
item.description: Windows 1.0 didn't exactly blow the industry away, but it laid the groundwork for Microsoft's future success.

item.title: NBC’s ‘Stumble’: Why does Hollywood insist on treating narcolepsy as a punchline?
item.description: The network’s new comedy series features an exaggerated depiction of the neurological condition for laughs. Experts say that could delay real diagnoses. NBC recently debuted a new show: Stumble, a comedy about a former cheer coach leading a team of misfits.

item.title: Verizon begins laying off more than 13,000 employees in a bid to ‘reorient’ the entire company
item.description: The layoffs account for about 20% of the company’s management workforce, which isn’t unionized. Verizon is laying off more than 13,000 employees in mass job reductions that arrive as the telecommunications giant says it must “reorient” its entire company.

item.title: Source: Kalshi’s valuation jumps to $11B after raising massive $1B round
item.description: The quickly growing prediction betting market raised fresh capital from Sequoia and CapitalG, according to someone familiar with the deal.

item.title: Even Realities Even G2 Review: Anti-Meta Smart Glasses With Real Potential
item.description: The Even G2 and the Even R1 smart ring feel like a solid stab at smart glasses, but they have a lot to figure out before they justify a hefty price tag.

item.title: Russian Volcano Keeps Spilling Lava Months After Waking From a 500-Year Nap
item.description: A NASA satellite recently captured a volcanic plume billowing from Krasheninnikova.

item.title: It’s actually happened – Android now works with Apple AirDrop for simple file-sharing, starting with the Pixel 10
item.description: Google has announced that Android's Quick Share now works with Apple's AirDrop for quick file-sharing, starting with the Pixel 10 –here's how it works.

item.title: Linux Creator Linus Torvalds Is Sort of Okay With Vibe Coding, Actually
item.description: "Vibe coding may be a horrible, horrible idea from a maintenance standpoint, if you actually tried to make a product," Torvalds said.

item.title: Got a Pixel 10? Google’s Android Phone Can Now Share Files With Apple’s AirDrop
item.description: You can now share deets (and other digital treats) across the mobile divide.

item.title: Wireless Earbuds Are Going Off the Rails Thanks to AI
item.description: Surprise, surprise, AI is getting smashed together with wireless earbuds in a big way.

item.title: Rian Johnson Explains Why a Muppets ‘Knives Out’ Crossover Wouldn’t Work
item.description: The 'Last Jedi' director has spent the week tempering expectations about an unlikely 'Knives Out' crossover—but says he's down to make his own 'Muppet' movie beyond that.

item.title: The 27 Best Movies on Apple TV, WIRED’s Picks (November 2025)
item.description: Come See Me in the Good Light, Highest 2 Lowest, and The Lost Bus are just a few of the movies you should be watching on Apple TV this month.

item.title: You can get up to 30 percent off Sonos speakers and soundbars right now
item.description: If you’ve been waiting for some relief after Sonos raised its prices earlier this year in response to US tariffs, Black Friday presents a rare opportunity. With many products on sale for their lowest price to date for Black Friday, and the Sonos app being in far better shape than it was a year ago, […]

item.title: NordVPN Plus vs Surfshark One – which is the best value VPN plan this Black Friday?
item.description: Two of our most popular plans, but which is the better value?

item.title: Why Trump’s AI diplomacy is doomed to fail
item.description: The U.S. is about to learn the hard limits of AI diplomacy. This week, chips were on the menu in the White House. “When you ask about AI and chips, Saudi Arabia has a huge need for computing power,” Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MBS) said at a press conference on Tuesday with President Trump, where he floated a potential $50-billion purchase of American microchips....

item.title: Vance tells Americans to have ‘a little bit of patience’ on high prices
item.description: ‘We hear you’ and ‘there’s a lot more work to do,’ the vice president said Thursday. While President Donald Trump has struggled to settle on a way to address Americans’ concerns about high costs, Vice President JD Vance on Thursday offered a more direct and empathetic message, saying, “We hear you” and “there’s a lot more work to do.”

item.title: OpenAI is launching group chats in ChatGPT
item.description: OpenAI is widely rolling out group chats inside ChatGPT, allowing you to invite up to 20 other people to your conversation with the AI chatbot. The feature is now available globally to all logged-in users, following a short pilot earlier this month. OpenAI positions the feature as a way to collaborate with friends, family members, […]

item.title: Did you know Apple launched a new product today? Get the Hikawa Phone Grip.
item.description: Apple partners with viral phone case designer Bailey Hikawa to launch an accessible phone grip.

item.title: Black Friday soundbar deals are here – save up to 44% on models from Sonos, Sony, LG and more
item.description: Black Friday deals have started, and there are great savings on a range of terrific soundbars, including record-low prices on Dolby Atmos models.

item.title: Feds charge four with illegally smuggling Nvidia AI chips to China
item.description: Federal prosecutors have charged four people with illegally smuggling Nvidia GPUs and HP supercomputers with Nvidia GPUs from the US to China, according to a court filing spotted by Court Watch. The US government has placed restrictions that prevent Nvidia from selling its most powerful chips for AI training to China, but Chinese companies like […]

item.title: Tesla is getting better about reporting FSD crash data — but the numbers are still misleading
item.description: Last week, Tesla revealed a new section of its website dedicated to reporting safety statistics for its advanced driver assist systems, Autopilot and Full Self-Driving (FSD). The new hub appears to be an attempt to move beyond the company's traditional quarterly safety reports, which have been criticized for failing to account for basic facts about […]...

item.title: I cant believe how cheap the basic Kindle is. Grab it for just $79.99 from Amazons Black Friday sale.
item.description: The basic Kindle is already an extremely affordable e-reader but ahead of Black Friday it's even more affordable. Grab it now for just $79.99 at Amazon.

item.title: 65+ early Black Friday deals: Score huge discounts on MacBooks, Kindles, Bose headphones, and Ninja appliances
item.description: Get the latest Black Friday deals on Apple products, vacuums, headphones, power stations, and Legos. Save $250 on a new Apple laptop and 27% on a new Kindle.

item.title: Don’t be a sucker this Black Friday – this compact robot vacuum’s down to its lowest price yet
item.description: Thanks to Black Friday, the SwitchBot K11+ is heavily discounted, so you should zoom it into your cart right now.

item.title: Gemini 3 is almost as good as Google says it is
item.description: Google set the bar high for Gemini 3. It's promising a bunch of upgraded features in its shiny new AI model, from generating code that produces interactive 3D visualizations to "agentic" capabilities that complete tasks. But as we've seen in the past, what's advertised doesn't always match up to reality. So we put some of […]

item.title: The best early Black Friday book deals to add to your cart
item.description: Shop the best early Black Friday book deals, including a buy one, get one 50% off sale at Amazon.

item.title: Quick Share devient compatible AirDrop : Google brise la frontière avec l’iPhone
item.description: C'est peut-être la plus grosse nouvelle tech de l'année pour l'interopérabilité. Après avoir plié sur le RCS, l'écosystème mobile s'ouvre encore un peu plus. Google lance l'interconnexion native entre Quick Share et AirDrop sur la série Pixel 10.
